thread.title: Cheryl's Girls Aloud bandmates rush to meet her and Liam Payne's adorable little boy
thread.title_full: Cheryl's Girls Aloud bandmates rush to meet her and Liam Payne's adorable little boy

author: Ashleigh Rainbird
title: Cheryl's Girls Aloud bandmates rush to meet her and Liam Payne's adorable little boy
text:
Showbiz Cheryl's Girls Aloud bandmates rush to meet her and Liam Payne's adorable little boy Kimberley Walsh and Nicola Roberts both dashed round to meet the couple's first child, who was born on Wednesday Share Liam Payne holds his baby son (Photo: cherylofficial/Instagram) Share Get     
Cheryl and Liam Payne were joined by family and bandmates to welcome their baby son. 
Liam’s mum, Karen, said she couldn’t stop crying, adding: “I have the most beautiful grandson in the world.” 
Girls Aloud star Cheryl , 33, gave birth to a boy weighing 7 lbs 9 on Wednesday, and the couple invited both sets of relatives down their home in Hertfordshire to share their joy on Friday. 
Cheryl’s bandmates Kimberley Walsh , 35, and Nicola Roberts, 31, both rushed to see the new addition to the family over the weekend, too. 
A source said: “There were children everywhere - Cheryl’s sister brought her children, so there were nieces and nephews running around everywhere. Plus everyone’s dogs. Cheryls Girls Aloud bandmates have rushed round to meet her son (Photo: PA) 
“Kimberley went straight round to Cheryl as soon as she heard the news, and Nicola popped over. Everyone is so happy for them. Both their families are thrilled.” 
Liam’s sister Nicola posted after meeting their as-yet-unamed son: “I honestly didn’t know love at first sight until today.” 
The 23-year-old’s sister Ruth wished Cheryl a happy mothers’ day , adding of the new baby: “Eeek, I just love him.” Proud dad Liam holds his baby son (Photo: cherylofficial/Instagram) 
One Direction star Liam’s mum wrote: “Finally I can boast that I am a grandmother! 
"The happiest grandmother. Everything I’ve been doing lately is crying, because I’m very happy…now I have the most beautiful grandson in the world.” 
Meanwhile, Cheryl’s former bandmates were quick to celebrate her happy news online. 
Nicola Roberts gushed the news was “heaven” and added: “Remember how we used to wonder what it would be like when we were older and the kids started coming... [love] you both and love so much that there’s little bubbas here now.” 
Mum-of-two Kimberley Walsh sent a string of hearts, while mum-of-one Nadine Coyle posted: “Congratulations @cherylofficial I am so so happy for you & your precious little boy & family! Sending you loads of love!…” 
The couple, who started dating at the start of last year, posted messages on Instagram revealing their happy news on Saturday night, with Liam writing: “My close friends and family know there are very few times when I’m left speechless... wow! Liam Payne and Cheryl (Photo: Getty) 
“I’m incredibly happy to welcome our new baby boy into the world, it’s a moment that I will never forget for the rest of my life and my favourite memory I have so far. 
“I’m completely in awe of his incredible mother and how she has been the whole way through this, she’s really made my dreams come true. 
"We haven’t named him yet but he’s already capturing hearts including mine. I feel very blessed. Happy Mother’s Day everyone!” 
Cheryl, who first met Liam when he was a contestant on the X Factor in 2011, wrote: “On Wednesday 22nd March Liam and I became parents to an incredibly beautiful, healthy baby boy, weighing 7lb 9 and looking like a dream. 
"Although he still doesn’t have a name he is already stealing hearts. We are all madly in love and overwhelmingly happy with our little arrival. 
"Happy Mother’s Day to all the mothers around the world. A day that now has a different meaning to me forever.” 
Cheryl welcomed the newborn in a £8,000 suite at the Kensington Wing of the Chelsea and Westminster hospital, where the specialist who delivered Princess Charlotte to the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge is a resident obstetrician.
